qas.question: What decade had significant studies of dog genes to determine origins?
Testing revealed today's dogs trace back by how many years?
What is the region where domesticated dogs ancestry traces to?
What type of diet can modern domesticated dogs thrive eating that other dogs cannot?
What was undertaken in 2010 to determine where dogs originated from?

context: Although initially thought to have originated as a manmade variant of an extant canid species (variously supposed as being the dhole, golden jackal, or gray wolf), <a4_0>extensive genetic studies<a4_0/> undertaken during the <a0_0>2010s<a0_0/> indicate that dogs diverged from an extinct wolf-like canid in <a2_0>Eurasia<a2_0/> <a1_0>40,000<a1_0/> years ago. Being the oldest domesticated animal, their long association with people has allowed dogs to be uniquely attuned to human behavior, as well as thrive on a <a3_0>starch-rich<a3_0/> diet which would be inadequate for other canid species.
